poem:
Title: "Morning Herald"

So much passion fills the inked page, 
the chatter of English politics,
echo in the brewing tea. 
From potholes to planning, a song of despair, 
Sunak's looming fate under the drizzle.

Voters' hands weighted with choices,
these echoes, but drops 
in the full vessel of thought.
Autumn's leaf or winter's harsh hand,
Whichever the season, 
they will choose.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From potholes to planning: key issues in England’s 2 May local elections This week’s local elections have been widely described as one of the toughest tests of Rishi Sunak’s 18-month premiership, with Westminster-watchers considering the results as portents of his fate in the coming national poll – considered to be coming this autumn. But while some voters in England may use their vote to bloody his nose this Thursday, a host of more local issues". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
